org.funcito

Class FuncitoCollectGen

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.funcito.FuncitoCollectGen

  • public class FuncitoCollectGen
extends Object
    This class is the static entry point of the Funcito API for Collections-Generic.

    • Method Detail

      • callsTo

        public static <T> T callsTo(Class<T> clazz)
        Generates a proxy object for use with other FuncitoCollectGen static methods. This proxy should not be used for any other purposes. It is a convenience pass-thru to FuncitoDelegate.callsTo(Class). Example usages are: 

         
     // inlined:
     Transformer<MyClass,RetType1> xform = transformerFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithRetType1() );

     // or extracted for repeat usage
     final MyClass CALLS_TO = callsTo(MyClass.class);
     Transformer<MyClass,RetType1> xform2 = transformerFor( CALLS_TO.method1WithRetType1() );
     Transformer<MyClass,RetType2> xform3 = transformerFor( CALLS_TO.method2WithRetType2() );

        Stubs are cached, so this method can be called multiple times for the same class without penalty. But a single proxy can also be reused for creating multiple Collections-Generic Transformer or Predicate objects.

        Parameters:
        clazz - is the class to be proxied
        Returns:
        a proxy which can be used by other FuncitoCollectGen static methods

      • transformerFor

        public static <T,V> Transformer<T,V> transformerFor(V proxiedMethodCall)
        Generates a Collections-Generic Transformer object that wraps a method call or method chain. Resulting Transformer is as thread-safe as the method itself. Example usage is:

        Transformer<MyClass,RetType1> xform = transformerFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithRetType1() );

        You can wrap methods with parameters, so long as you statically provide values for each parameter. Provided parameter values are statically bound to the Transformer and may not be changed:

        Transformer<MyClass,RetType1> xform = transformerFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithArgs("abc", 123L) );
        // all invocations of xform will use "abc" and 123L as the arguments to methodWithArgs

        It is also possible to wrap method call chains, with some restrictions:

        MyClass callsTo = callsTo(MyClass.class);
        Transformer<MyClass,RetType2> xform = transformerFor( callsTo.methodWithRetType1().methodWithRetType2() );

        Restrictions for chaining are that intermediate return types (all except for the final return type in the chain) must be proxyable by the current Proxy provider, just like the initial target type. In the above example this means MyClass and RetType1 must be proxyable, but RetType2 need not be proxyable. Intermediate return types also cannot be a Java Generic type because of type erasure.

        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the return value from a method call to a FuncitoCollectGen proxy object
        Returns:
        a Collections-Generic Transformer object that wraps the method call or chain.

      • transformerFor

        public static <T,V> Transformer<T,V> transformerFor(V proxiedMethodCall,

        Parameters:

        mode - is the TypedMode that modifies the mode of execution of the resulting Transformer
        Returns:
        a collections-generic Transformer object that wraps the method call or chain.
        See Also:

      • predicateFor

        public static <T> Predicate<T> predicateFor(Boolean proxiedMethodCall)
        Generates a Collections-Generic Predicate object that wraps a Boolean- or boolean-return method call or method chain. Resulting Predicate is as thread-safe as the method itself. Auto-boxing means you may always safely wrap a method that has a primitive boolean return type. Example usage is:

        Predicate<MyClass> pred = predicateFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithBoolRetType() );

        Users of this Predicate should be aware of a risk with Collections-Generic Predicates (not specific to Funcito) if the return type of the method being wrapped is a Boolean wrapper rather than a primitive boolean. Such calls are allowed, but there is an inherent null-pointer risk because Collections-Generic Predicate.evaluate(T) returns a boolean primitive. Use overloaded form of this method predicateFor(Boolean, org.funcito.mode.Mode) with the TailDefault TypedMode for a mitigation of this risk.

        This method also supports wrapping methods with arguments, and method chaining, as documented in transformerFor(Object).

        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the Boolean return value from a method call to a FuncitoCollectGen proxy object
        Returns:
        a Collections-Generic Predicate object that wraps the method call or method chain.
        See Also:
        predicateFor(Boolean, boolean)

      • predicateFor

        public static <T> Predicate<T> predicateFor(Boolean proxiedMethodCall,
                            boolean defaultForNull)
        Generates a Collections-Generic Predicate object that wraps a Boolean- or boolean-return method call or method chain. Resulting Predicate is as thread-safe as the method itself. This form of the method is only required when there is a risk of the wrapped method returning a null-value, in which you case you provide the default value to substitute for null return values from the wrapped method.

        This method also supports wrapping methods with arguments, and method chaining, as documented in transformerFor(Object).

        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the Boolean return value from a method call to a FuncitoCollectGen callsTo object
        defaultForNull - is the default value that Predicate will return if the wrapped method returns a null-value.
        Returns:
        a Collections-Generic Predicate object that wraps the method call or method chain.
        See Also:
        predicateFor(Boolean)

      • closureFor

        public static <T> Closure<T> closureFor(Object proxiedMethodCall)
        Generates a Collections-Generic Closure object that wraps a method call or method chain. Resulting Closure is as thread-safe as the method/chain itself. This Closure generator can only be used for method calls/chains with a non-void return type, even though the return type is ignored. For a Closure generator that works with void returning methods/chains, see voidClosure(). Example usage is:

        Closure<MyClass> cmd = closureFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithNonVoidReturnType() );

        You can wrap methods with parameters, so long as you statically provide values for each parameter. Provided parameter values are statically bound to the Closure and may not be changed:

        Closure<MyClass> cmd = closureFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithArgs("abc", 123L) );
        // all invocations of closure will use "abc" and 123L as the arguments to methodWithArgs

        It is also possible to wrap method call chains, with some restrictions:

        MyClass callMyClass = callsTo(MyClass.class);
        Closure<MyClass> cmd = closureFor( callsMyClass.methodWithRetType1().methodWithRetType2() );

        Restrictions for chaining are that intermediate return types (all except for the final return type in the chain) must be proxyable by the current Proxy provider, just like the initial target type. In the above example this means MyClass and RetType1 must be proxyable, but RetType2 need not be proxyable. Intermediate return types also cannot be a Java Generic type because of type erasure.

        Type Parameters:
        T - is the input type of the Closure
        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the return value from an inlined method call to a FuncitoFJ proxy object
        Returns:
        a Collections-Generic Closure object that wraps a method call or chain.
        See Also:
        voidClosure()

      • closureFor

        public static <T> Closure<T> closureFor(Object proxiedMethodCall,
                        TypedMode<Void> mode)
        TypedMode version of FuncitoCollectGen.closureFor(Object)
        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the return value from a method call to a FuncitoCollectGen proxy object
        mode - is the TypedMode that modifies the mode of execution of the resulting Closure
        Returns:
        a collections-generic Closure object that wraps the method call or chain.
        See Also:
        closureFor(Object), Modes, TypedMode

      • closureFor

      • prepareVoid

        public static <T> T prepareVoid(T t)
        Prepares a method-call or method-chain call that terminates with a void return type, for generation of a Collections-Generic Closure object. Use of this method must be followed with execution of one of the void-Closure methods: voidClosure(), voidClosure(TypedMode), voidClosure(Mode). Resulting Closure is as thread-safe as the method/chain itself. Example usage is:

        prepareVoid(callsTo(MyClass.class)).methodWithVoidReturnType();

        You can wrap methods with parameters, so long as you statically provide values for each parameter. Provided parameter values are statically bound to the Closure and may not be changed:

        prepareVoid(callsTo(MyClass.class)).voidMethodWithArgs("abc", 123L);
        // all invocations of closure will use "abc" and 123L as the arguments to voidMethodWithArgs

        It is also possible to wrap method call chains, with some restrictions:

        MyClass callMyClass = callsTo(MyClass.class);
        prepareVoid(callsMyClass).methodWithRetType1().voidMethod();

        Restrictions for chaining are that intermediate return types (final return type does not matter because it is void) must be proxyable by the current Proxy provider, just like the initial target type. In the above example this means MyClass and RetType1 must be proxyable. Intermediate return types also cannot be a Java Generic type because of type erasure.

        Type Parameters:
        T - is the input type of the Closure being prepared
        Returns:
        the same Funcito proxy object that is passed in. Provided for fluent API so that desired method chain call may be directly appended.
        See Also:
        voidClosure()

      • voidClosure

        public static <T> Closure<T> voidClosure()
        Generates a Collections-Generic Closure object that wraps a method call or method chain. Resulting Closure is as thread-safe as the method/chain itself. This Closure generator is only appropriate for method calls/chains with a void return type, and it requires previous usage of prepareVoid(Object). Example usage is:

        prepareVoid(callsTo(MyClass.class)).methodWithVoidReturnType();
        Closure<MyClass> cmd = voidClosure();

        Type Parameters:
        T - is the input type of the Closure
        Returns:
        a Collections-Generic Closure object that wraps a previously prepared method call or chain.
        See Also:
        prepareVoid(Object)

      • voidClosure

        public static <T> Closure<T> voidClosure(TypedMode<Void> mode)
        TypedMode version of FuncitoCollectGen.voidClosure()
        Parameters:
        mode - is the TypedMode that modifies the mode of execution of the resulting Closure
        Returns:

        See Also:

      • voidClosure

        Parameters:
